displaytitle: Scene from Roman History (From the Façade of the Palazzo Milesi)
medium: Red chalk with white lead heightening, partially oxidized, on tan paper
creditline: Gift of Emily Townsend Vermeule, honorary degree holder of the Class of 1989, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule III, in memory of Alphaeus Hyatt Mayor, Class of 1922, George Rodney Meneely, Class of 1933, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule Jr., Class of 1917
markings: Watermark: Letter or column inside a three-pointed shield over three mountains
inscribed:
Inscribed verso, lower left, in graphite: 12/19 TAN; left
center, in graphite: B1450; lower right, in graphite: 13

titles.title: Scene from Roman History (From the Façade of the Palazzo Milesi)

caption: After Polidoro Caldara, called Polidoro da Caravaggio (Italian, 1499 - 1543), Scene from Roman History (From the Façade of the Palazzo Milesi). Red chalk with white lead heightening, partially oxidized, on tan paper; 40.1 × 24.2 cm. Gift of Emily Townsend Vermeule, honorary degree holder of the Class of 1989, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule III, in memory of Alphaeus Hyatt Mayor, Class of 1922, George Rodney Meneely, Class of 1933, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule Jr., Class of 1917 (1997-60)
